;;2023 年 1 月 8 日，巴西前总统雅伊尔·博尔索纳罗的支持者在巴西利亚与保卫巴西国民议会的安全部队对峙。
;

;在巴西举行与 1 月 8 日巴西叛乱有关的首次审判时，一名最高法院法官宣布，对拉丁美洲最大民主国家进行“卑鄙的叛乱袭击”背后充满仇恨的破坏者必须被绳之以法。

;

;;数千名关注者今年 1 月 8 日，前总统雅伊尔·博尔索纳罗 (Jair Bolsonaro) 在巴西首都进行了抢劫，他的左翼继任者路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦 (Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva) 称这是一次未遂政变。 ;总统府、最高法院和国会被博尔索纳里斯塔激进分子洗劫，他们对博尔索纳里斯塔在去年十月选举中的失败感到愤怒。

;

;周三，前四名被指控的骚乱者在翻修一新的最高法院大楼举行的一次极具象征意义的听证会上接受了审判，在一月份的起义中被彻底摧毁。

;
;

;;相关：;;“他们欣喜若狂”：博尔索纳罗暴民的暴力狂欢如何震撼巴西利亚;

;
;

;最高法院法官亚历山大·德·莫赖斯 (Alexandre de Moraes) 描述了右翼叛乱分子如何横冲直撞巴西民主的核心，“表现出对共和国的彻底蔑视，并充满了无知的大胆”。

;

;骚乱者 - 莫赖斯声称他们是“被非理性、近乎病态的仇恨所占据”——在执行南美版本的;2021 年 1 月 6 日美国国会大厦遭到袭击;。 “但是让我明确一点：他们并没有摧毁民主精神，”最高法院法官说。

;

;“自由的敌人应该知道，在这个法院的神圣土地上，永久培养了民主精神。”巴西司法部副部长卡洛斯·弗雷德里科·桑托斯 (Carlos Frederico Santos) 在对 51 岁的阿埃西奥·卢西奥·科斯塔·佩雷拉 (Aécio Lúcio Costa Pereira) 提起诉讼时，也表达了类似的挑衅态度。一月份袭击背后的“武装反民主暴徒”。

;

;“值得注意的是……巴西很久以前就不再是香蕉共和国了，”桑托斯说。 “我们已经翻开了历史上政变的一页。”

;

;佩雷拉和其他三名被告——蒂亚戈·德·阿西斯·马塔尔、莫阿西尔·何塞·多斯桑托斯和马修斯·利马·德·卡瓦略·拉萨罗——被指控犯有罪行这可能会让他们入狱长达 30 年。它们是：武装犯罪团伙、暴力废除民主法治、政变以及使用易燃物质造成公共财产损坏。

;

;所有四人均否认这些指控，并表示他们去了前往巴西利亚参加和平抗议。预计未来几个月还有 200 多名其他嫌疑人将面临审判，同时还有 1,000 多名嫌疑人正在接受较轻指控的调查。

;

;佩雷拉的律师在周三的审判中驳回了对他的指控，《O Globo》报纸称此次审判为惩罚“针对民主的卑鄙罪行”的历史性机会。

;

;塞巴斯蒂昂·科埃略·达席尔瓦否认他的当事人是一个危险或暴力的人，他的当事人拍摄到自己穿着 T 恤冲进参议院大楼，要求军事干预。

;

;事实上，席尔瓦声称对佩雷拉不利的唯一证据之一是在通往国会的坡道上拍摄的一段视频，其中被告宣布计划通过在里面排空肠子来表达他对政客的厌恶。 “他做了[便便]吗？这件事实现了吗？”律师询问法庭，然后回答说：“不，这没有发生。”

;

;席尔瓦还嘲笑了有关一月份的动乱是一场未遂政变的说法，与最近推翻尼日尔政府的事件类似。 “我们真的要在历史上写下一场没有任何武器的政变吗？”律师说。 “有人有步枪吗？”

;

;在 1 月 8 日审判的同时，联邦警察继续追捕巴西现代历史上最严重的政治暴力爆发之一的政治策划者和财政支持者。

;

;许多人怀疑博尔索纳罗——巴西前军事独裁政权和智利独裁者奥古斯托·皮诺切特的公开崇拜者——本人参与了煽动暴力事件。卢拉本周声称博尔索纳罗“全力参与”;所谓的推翻政府的阴谋。前总统否认了此类说法。

;

;然而，博尔索纳罗的前副官毛罗·西德中校最近与警方调查人员达成了一项认罪协议，根据该协议，他必须提供有关几项刑事调查的信息，包括 1 月 8 日的袭击。媒体报道称，西德中校的爆料可能会让博尔索纳罗以及几位重要盟友和亲属的生活变得复杂化。

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 01:52:01 +0800 ‘A lifeline for dirty cars’: EU backs new air pollution limits, but not until 2035https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/sep/13/eu-air-pollution-limits-2035
;;2023-09-13T16:20:34Z;
;
;;2022 年 1 月巴黎上空的空气污染
;

;欧盟投票通过设置来清洁空气对污染物进行严格限制，专家称此举将拯救生命和金钱。

;

;欧洲议会周三同意将几种危险物质的浓度限制在世界卫生组织 (WHO) 提出的水平。但在遭到中右翼政客的强烈反对后，它决定将达到世界卫生组织限制的日期再推迟五年。

;

;“这对所有欧洲公民，尤其是数百万欧洲公民来说，都是个好消息。哥本哈根大学流行病学家、欧洲呼吸学会环境与健康委员会主席 Zorana Jovanovic Andersen 表示：“患有哮喘和慢性阻塞性肺病等肺部疾病的人”。

;

;此次投票“是一项尽管与世界卫生组织的全面协调从 2030 年推迟到 2035 年，但这是朝着人人享有清洁空气的正确方向迈出的重要一步。”她说。

;

;欧洲城市地区几乎每个人都呼吸着含有足够细颗粒的空气违反了世界卫生组织 5 µg/m3 的年度指导水平。这些被称为 PM2.5 的颗粒足够小，可以进入血液，并在血液中传播到全身并损害器官。

;

;科学家和医生估计，室外空气污染 - 包括其他有害气体，例如二氧化氮、二氧化硫和臭氧——每年在欧洲夺走 30 万人的生命。

;

;“我们面临着空气污染，一场缓慢蔓延的流行病，”中左翼标准普尔西班牙议员哈维·洛佩斯 (Javi López) 表示;D 负责该提案的人员分组。 “政府应该像对抗流行病一样对抗空气污染。”

;

;空气质量法的更新以 363 票通过，其细节现在将在与欧洲理事会的谈判中最终确定。赞成票 226 票反对。欧盟委员会主席、欧洲绿色协议倡导者乌苏拉·冯德莱恩所属的中右翼欧洲人民党 (EPP) 对该提案投了反对票。

;

;“通过这次投票，产生了新的德国欧洲议会议员兼欧洲议会环境发言人彼得·利泽 (Peter Liese) 表示：“这会带来驾驶禁令甚至关闭建筑工地和工厂的风险。”

;

;他表示，大多数支持该法律的政客都是不负责任的行为。 “我们将继续打击过度措施。进一步改善空气质量是重要而正确的目标。但我们应该依靠技术而不是禁令。”

;

;欧洲议会中最大的民选官员团体 EPP 近几个月来打破了其对绿色协议的一贯支持。它几乎推翻了;恢复自然的法律; 7 月，并开展了一场公开运动，科学家批评该运动散布错误信息。

;

;对空气质量法的反对“同样强烈，但更不受关注”，政策经理玛格丽塔·托洛托 (Margherita Tolotto) 说环境非营利组织欧洲环境局的空气和噪音问题。 “我确实认为他们对违背空气质量目标感到更加羞愧，因为在公共场合说：‘嘿，听着，我正在游说你继续呼吸被污染的空气。’”

;
;

;;相关：;;揭示：空气污染可能正在损害“身体的每个器官”;

;
;

;肮脏的空气不仅危害人类健康，还阻碍经济发展，因为政府必须在医疗保健上投入更多资金，而人们请病假的时间也更长。欧盟委员会在 ; 中发现报告;称，到 2030 年完全遵守世界卫生组织对 PM2.5 的限制，将比较弱的规则更能促进经济发展。

;

;研究人员计算出，每年给社会带来的净收益为 900 亿欧元如果 PM2.5 水平限制在 15 µg/m3，则需要花费 770 亿英镑；如果将 PM2.5 水平降至 5 µg/m3，则需要花费 1,230 亿欧元。

;

;议会批准的提案呼吁更好地监测空气污染和更容易获取的信息。它还包括一些条款，如果政府不遵守这些限制，人们将获得更大的赔偿权利。

;

;扎卡里·阿兹达 (Zachary Azdad)，非营利性交通与运输协会的车辆政策官员。环境部表示，该法律是朝着正确方向迈出的一步，但“由于多年来本可以避免的空气污染，推迟与世界卫生组织的协调将导致生命损失”。

;

;“今天的投票对于加速推出“欧洲的低排放和零排放地区，为肮脏的柴油和汽油汽车提供了生命线。”他说。

;

;空气污染是 2019 年全球过早死亡的第四大风险因素，仅次于血压、吸烟和饮食发挥着更大的作用。

;

;“其他三个你可以控制，”杜塞尔多夫大学环境流行病学家芭芭拉霍夫曼说。 “如果您患有高血压，可以服用药物治疗。你可以戒烟，或者你不能开始吸烟，并且你可以有健康的饮食。

;

;“你无法确定自己呼吸的空气。”

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 00:52:01 +0800 Morocco earthquake: Macron tries to soothe tensions after frosty response to offer of aidhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/13/morocco-earthquake-macron-tries-to-soothe-tensions-after-frosty-response-to-offer-of-aid

;
;;援助人员和援助包裹
;

;法国总统埃马纽埃尔·马克龙试图缓和紧张局势在;致命地震;集中在阿特拉斯山脉高处。

;

;在摩洛哥军方支持下的搜救队继续进行疯狂搜索，以定位并从偏远地区空运伤员上周五发生了 6.8 级地震的阿特拉斯山脉的山区村庄。但随着救援工作持续第五天，找到幸存者的机会正在减弱。

;

;摩洛哥当局本周早些时候表示，他们对 ;来自英国、西班牙、卡塔尔和其他国家的搜救队提供帮助;阿拉伯联合酋长国，但拒绝接受包括法国在内的其他国家的援助。

;

;在社交媒体上发布的向摩洛哥公众发表的视频中，马克龙表示这是摩洛哥的主权问题;是否接受法国援助;。此前，在德里举行的 G20 峰会上，他曾表示法国已经做了“我们能做的一切”，并将在收到请求后立即部署援助。

;

;摩洛哥对任何有关该国缺乏能力的说法感到愤怒

;

;“过去几天发生了很多毫无根据的争议，”马克龙在视频中说道，该视频是在法国非政府组织前往马拉喀什以南地震区和拉巴特持续沉默。 “有可能直接提供人道主义援助。显然，国王陛下和摩洛哥政府应以完全符合其主权的方式组织国际援助，”他说。

;

;“我希望所有这些使问题分裂和复杂化的争议都将得到解决。出于对所有相关人员的尊重，在这个已经悲惨的时刻可以平息下来。”

;

;甚至在地震发生之前，两国之间的紧张局势就已经加剧。摩洛哥已经几个月没有向法国派遣大使，马克龙也取消了对拉巴特的几次国事访​​问计划。法国对摩洛哥的殖民统治从 1912 年持续到 1956 年，长期以来给两国关系蒙上了阴影。

;

;然而，摩洛哥国王穆罕默德六世据信大部分时间都在他的多个私人宫殿中度过。法国的住所，由巴黎附近的城堡或埃菲尔铁塔附近的豪宅进行管理。

;

;一位接近摩洛哥王宫的消息人士表示，王宫或外交部不太可能对马克龙的视频信息做出反应.

;

;“在摩洛哥，我们不通过 Twitter 进行治理，”他们说。 “这段视频是对治理的嘲弄。他无权直接向摩洛哥人民讲话……他试图防止进一步的争议，但这些争议都是他利用社交媒体自己制造和助长的。”

;

;围绕援助的争议不受限制仅涉及摩洛哥与法国的关系。本周早些时候，阿尔及利亚宣布将开放领空，允许人道主义援助抵达摩洛哥，这是阿尔及尔与其邻国断交后的一个深刻转变 ;两年前;，因为摩洛哥所谓的“敌对行动”。

;

;几天后，阿尔及利亚国家电视台播放了急救人员在布法里克镇附近的一个军用机场的停机坪上排队，准备登上附近三架向摩洛哥运送援助物资的飞机。

;

;摩洛哥司法部长阿卜杜勒拉蒂夫·瓦赫比 (Abdellatif Ouahbi) 告诉沙特阿拉伯卫星频道 Al Arabiya，拉巴特将接受阿尔及利亚的援助，尽管摩洛哥媒体后来声称他的言论被误解，并否认拉巴特将接受援助的任何暗示。

;

;阿尔及利亚外交部随后通过国家新闻机构发表声明，并补充说“阿尔及利亚政府注意到摩洛哥王国的官方回应，摩洛哥王国表示不需要阿尔及利亚提出的人道主义援助。

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 00:52:01 +0800 Julian Assange: more than 60 Australian MPs urge US to let WikiLeaks founder walk freehttps://www.theguardian.com/media/2023/sep/14/julian-assange-more-than-60-australian-mps-urge-us-to-let-wikileaks-founder-walk-free

;
;;维基解密创始人朱利安·阿桑奇 (Julian Assange) 抵达伦敦法庭，因 2019 年违反保释罪被判刑。
;

;超过 60 名澳大利亚联邦政界人士明确呼吁美国放弃对朱利安·阿桑奇的起诉，并警告称，如果引渡这位维基解密创始人，“澳大利亚将引发强烈而持续的抗议”。

;

; href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2023/sep/05/australian-mps-to-lobby-us-to-drop-julian-assange-prosecution-or-risk-very-dangerous -precedent-for-rus-and-china">;小型跨党派代表团将于下周飞往华盛顿;，《卫报》透露，此次游说之旅获得了澳大利亚众议院 63 名议员的公开支持

;

;63 名议员和参议员在一封信中表示，他们支持美国之行，并“坚决认为必须结束对澳大利亚公民朱利安·阿桑奇的起诉和监禁” ”。

;

;他们表示，此事已经“拖延了十多年”，“考虑到阿桑奇先生被拘留的时间和情况，他受到进一步迫害并被剥夺自由是错误的”。

;

;“这没有任何意义，也是不公正的，我们明确表示——作为朋友应该始终对朋友诚实——对阿桑奇先生的长期追捕削弱了尊重和尊重的坚实基础。信中说：“澳大利亚人对美利坚合众国司法系统的尊重。”

;

;阿桑奇仍被关押在伦敦贝尔马什监狱，;与美国试图引渡他的行为作斗争;，以面临指控——包括根据《间谍法》。这些指控与;数十万份泄露的内容有关2010 年和 2011 年有关阿富汗和伊拉克战争的文件;以及外交电报。

;

;阿桑奇 ;2012 年在厄瓜多尔驻伦敦大使馆寻求庇护;，并在那里一直呆到 2019 年。当厄瓜多尔撤销其签证时，这名澳大利亚公民被捕澳大利亚议员和参议员表示，他们同意总理安东尼·阿尔巴内塞 (Anthony Albanese) 的评论，即“够了”就足够了……朱利安·阿桑奇的持续监禁没有任何作用”。

;

;他们还欢迎 ;最近支持反对党领袖彼得·达顿;，表达了这一两党立场“与澳大利亚议会内部广泛的跨党派和独立支持相匹配，这反过来又反映了澳大利亚社会的强烈观点”。

;

;“毫无疑问，如果朱利安·阿桑奇 (Julian Assange)这封信是由“带朱利安·阿桑奇回家”议会小组的联合召集人：独立议员安德鲁·威尔基（Andrew Wilkie）组织的。 、工党议员 Josh Wilson、自由党议员 Bridget Archer 和绿党参议员 David Shoebridge。

;

;签署者总数（63 名澳大利亚联邦政界人士）反映了跨党派对此问题日益达成的共识。相比之下，有 48 名;四月签署了一封致美国司法部长梅里克·加兰的信;。

;

;Three people have been wounded by bullets that were sprayed at anti-government protesters in the southern Syrian city of Suwayda, activists and local journalists have said, in the first reported use of violence in weeks-long demonstrations there.

;Assad recaptured most of the country with help from his allies Russia and Iran. Even with frontlines calmer, the country's economy remains in tatters and its humanitarian needs have skyrocketed.

;

;An award-winning Russian journalist living in exile in Europe was hacked using Israeli spyware made by NSO Group, according to a joint investigation by the Citizen Lab and Access Now.

;

;Galina Timchenko was hacked on or around 23 February, at a time when she was based in Berlin, Germany, marking the first time that a Russian journalist – ;whose media outlet has been targeted by Moscow and ldeclared an “undesirable organisation”; – has been hacked.

;

;The news has raised questions about who might be behind the attack. Researchers said they were not immediately able to identify who might have targeted Timchenko's phone, but said it was hacked using Pegasus, one of the world's most sophisticated military-grade spyware tools.

;

;;Russia; would be considered an obvious candidate to have targeted Timchenko, who is the co-founder and chief executive of Meduza, an independent Russian news website that has a record of publishing critical articles about the war in Ukraine and investigations into the Russian elite, including those close to Vladimir Putin.

;

;NSO, which is closely regulated by the Israeli government, sells only to government agencies. The company is known to sell to authorities in many European countries – including the German police – and countries in the Middle East and Africa.

;

;The Citizen Lab and Access Now said they believed it was “unlikely” that Russia was a client of NSO Group, and emphasised that they had not seen any other indications from research that Moscow might be behind the attack.

;

;The declaration left a few other possible options, the researchers said. Meduza is based in Latvia, which appears to be an NSO Group customer. But researchers said there was no evidence that Latvia had the ability to use Pegasus software outside its own border.

;

;Germany is a known client, too, but the researchers said they believed it was unlikely that that a German police agency – which is believed to use Pegasus – had targeted her. The Netherlands Intelligence and Security Service, the Dutch intelligence agency, and an Estonian government agency both appear to use Pegasus outside their jurisdiction, including within Europe.

;

;The Guardian has previously reported that Estonia, a Nato member, acquired access to Pegasus in 2019 but was informed by NSO in August that year that ;the company would not permit Estonian officials to use the spyware against Russian targets;.

;

;Timchenko was using a Latvian country code at the time she was hacked.

;

;“It is plausible that one of these agencies was targeting Timchenko although it would be unclear under what justification,” researchers said. They added that it was possible that a Russian ally known to be a Pegasus customer could be behind the spying on behalf of Russia, including Azerbaijan or Kazakhstan, though researchers said they had never observed attacks against individuals living in the EU by either country.

;

;NSO was not immediately available for comment. The company has said it sells its spyware to countries to be used only to fight serious crime and terrorism threats. It has also denied having any knowledge or control of individuals who are targeted once their spyware licenses are sold to government clients, who then operate the hacking software.

;

;Meduza was declared an “undesirable organisation” by the Russian government earlier this year, making it virtually impossible to conduct reporting or collect revenue in the country. Before founding Meduza, Timchenko was the editor of Lenta.ru, an extremely popular website that pioneered online news in Russia.

;

;Timchenko was fired by Lenta.ru's billionaire owner due to her team's reporting on the 2014 Ukraine crisis. The decision sparked ;a staff revolt that resulted in Timchenko co-founding Meduza; in Riga, Latvia, where she believed the website would have more protection from the Russian government and Kremlin-friendly businessmen.

;

;She is one of the most prominent Russian journalists outside the country. She appears regularly at academic forums and events, including those that attract prominent figures in the Russian opposition and émigré communities.

;;Firefighters work to put out a fire and rescue people at an apartment block in Hanoi, Vietnam.
;

;Vietnamese police have announced that 56 people died from a fire in a nine-floor apartment building in the capital, Hanoi.

;

;The blaze began shortly after 11 pm on Tuesday when many of the roughly 150 people living in the building were asleep or getting ready for bed.

;

;Firefighters extinguished the fire in about an hour, while footage from the scene showed intense flames shooting through windows on every floor.

;

;At least 70 people were rescued from the building, with some injured when they jumped onto neighbouring roofs to escape the inferno. Nearly 40 people were injured, police said.

;

;While the cause of the fire is under investigation, ;images of its aftermath; depict dozens of charred motorbikes and bicycles on the ground floor, with apartment interiors incinerated.

;

;Fire safety is a frequent concern in Vietnam's packed major cities. Officials place Hanoi's ;population density; at 22,000 people per square kilometre, which would make it one of the most densely populated cities in the world.

;

;Most homes and small apartment buildings are built directly next to each other and designed in a long, narrow '“tube” style. This means many buildings only have windows at their front and back, and these are commonly blocked by security bars.

; ;

;Pictures from Tuesday night ;showed residents looking out through security bars ;while covering their faces with their shirts amid smoke from the fire.

;

;It is also common for buildings to have a rolling garage door at their entrance that cannot be opened if a fire cuts the electricity supply. Additionally, Hanoi's older neighbourhoods, such as the one where this fire took place, feature warrens of narrow alleys that make it difficult for emergency vehicles to access homes.

;

;While hospitals and officials continue to assess the final death toll, ;a public security leader, Le Van Tuyen, said; the fire caused “very heavy” damage and that the number of people killed or injured is “very large”.

;

;The prime minister, Pham Minh Chinh, visited the burned building, as well as victims being treated in nearby medical facilities. He announced that the government would cover all treatment costs. “Such a high-rise building, up to 10 floors, which looks like a mini apartment block, has no escape route. It is unacceptable when [the apartment block which houses] 45 households has no exit,” Chinh said.

;

;The blaze is the deadliest fire in Vietnam since a ;fire at a karaoke parlour; in a province neighbouring Ho Chi Minh City killed 32 people in September 2022. That tragedy led to a nationwide inspection of karaoke facilities and new fire safety regulations.

;“No one seems to be afraid, and they're giving us updates quite regularly,” Hill said.
